summary: Maisie Williams verrät: So wird das "Game of Thrones"-Finale für Arya Stark
title: Maisie Williams verrät: So wird das "Game of Thrones"-Finale für Arya Stark
body:
Grausam, überraschend, vorhersehbar? Nichts von alledem. Wie Maisie Williams das Finale für ihren “Game of Thrones”-Charakter beschreibt, ist tatsächlich eine Überraschung – und stimmt Fans ihrer außergewöhnlichen Rolle optimistisch!

Von Anfang an begeistert die widerspenstige, freche und mutige Rolle der Arya Stark in “Game of Thrones”. Dass der mittlerweile 21-Jährigen ein besonderes Finale bevorstehen wird, hoffen ihre Fans, welche die Schauspielerin quasi beim Erwachsenwerden beobachten konnten, aus tiefstem Herzen. In einem Interview mit dem britischen “Guardian” stimmte Maisie Williams die GoT-Liebhaber nun optimistisch. Auf die Frage, wie das Finale für ihren Serien-Charakter enden werde, antwortete sie: “wunderschön”.

Die achte und finale Staffel der erfolgreichsten Serie der Welt wird für Arya Stark “mit der perfekten Szene enden.” Zwar werde sie allein sein, was für die Fans keine Überraschung sein sollte, da die jüngste Tochter des Lords Eddard Stark “verdammt noch mal auf sich allein gestellt ist”. Wir fassen zusammen: Ihre letzte GoT-Szene wird Arya ohne Gesellschaft verbringen, trotzdem wird es wunderschön.

Dass die Dreharbeiten für die achte Staffel abgeschlossen sind, findet Williams nicht weiter schlimm: “Ich bin zum Ende gekommen und dann wollte ich auch nicht mehr.” Die Erschöpfung habe auch damit zu tun gehabt, dass sie in der achten Staffel deutlich mehr arbeiten musste. “Das lag hauptsächlich daran, dass es weniger Rollen gab – also musste jeder mehr arbeiten”, so die Schauspielerin zum “Guardian”.

Die finalen sechs Folgen der achten Staffel werden im Frühjahr 2019 erscheinen. Zeit genug also, um die sieben verfügbaren Staffeln noch mal durchzubingen! Verfügbar sind sie auf Sky Ticket, Sky Go und Sky Q.

summary: The simple truth is that S@nsa does not parallel Lyanna in any way.  Not when it comes to personality or storyarc.  Any...
body:
The simple truth is that S@nsa does not parallel Lyanna in any way. Not when it comes to personality or storyarc. Any similarities are shallow. Basically when I see anyone comparing S@nsa to Lyanna I mainly see even more disrespect being hurled at Arya. Arya parallels Lyanna, not S@nsa. I swear that as soon as they know that Lyanna shed a tear at Rhaegar’s harp playing, they dismiss any notion of Arya paralleling Lyanna. Because how could a tomboy who plays with swords and horses possibly be paralleling a girl who fell in love, married, and gave birth before she was 16? Why is it so hard to see that Arya is more than just a tomboy and a sword? She is a fully formed character who is also a girl who admired other women that had more “feminine” qualities, feels that women are just as important as men, befriends anyone regardless of class, names babies before they are born, took care of a toddler in the riverlands, and loves flowers. And this is just the tip of the iceberg. I don’t even know why I have to explain this as it’s right in the books, clear as day.

Arya parallels Lyanna, end of story. Stop taking from Arya just to give to S@nsa.

summary: Maisie Williams parla di Arya Stark: "Il suo finale è bellissimo"
body:
Maisie Williams parla di Arya Stark: “Il suo finale è bellissimo”

La frase:

“Ed è sola” riferendosi ad Arya alla fine della storia, mi preoccupa abbastanza.

Nel mio immaginario Arya o sarebbe morta (facendomi piangere come un vitello) o avrebbe concluso il tutto insieme agli altri Stark.

Ed invece oltre ad averci spoileriato che Arya non morirà, Maisie con le sue parole mi fa pensare che:

O tutti gli altri Stark muoiono e lei rimane da sola.

O dopo la guerra lei abbandona la sua famiglia per andarsene. (Essos?)

Qualunque sia la verità continuo a sperare in un bel finale per questo personaggio.

summary: Hi ! Don't you think it's strange in universe that Arya never knew or never talked of Jonquil Darke, the Scarlet Shadow ?
question: Hi ! Don't you think it's strange in universe that Arya never knew or never talked of Jonquil Darke, the Scarlet Shadow ?
answer:
Nope, because unfortunately the Doylist elements are too strong here – Jonquil Darke didn’t exist until GRRM wrote her this year. (OK, considering his favorite tropes, possibly she’s existed in his head for some time; but she didn’t truly exist until she was put on paper.)

If one must go for a Watsonian explanation, it may be that over the course of 250 years, northern records that mentioned Jonquil Darke were lost, and songs about her were forgotten. Maybe she appears in some flanderized or otherwise unrecognizable form in a few stories about Alysanne (the kind of stories Sansa loves), nothing that Arya would find notable or memorable. Like, consider how Bran thinks of Princess Nymeria as only “some old witch queen in the songs”, and she’s far more significant to historical records and literature than Jonquil Darke. Also consider how Bran tells the story of Queenscrown and the New Gift, how Alysanne got bored while her husband and Lord Stark were talking business and flew off to the Wall, a story that barely holds any resemblance to the historical record… no wonder a far less significant personage like Jonquil just vanishes.

But who knows… retcons could abound. If in TWOW Arya talks about the Scarlet Shadow of Duskendale, one of her heroes… don’t be surprised.

title: The Dark-Dragon and The Wolf-Prophet
description:
by Lyze

“Take me,” she whispered to the Many-Faced-God. “Take me home.”

He granted her wish. Just not in the way she had imagined.

The Many-Faced-God had plans for her.

 

And, really, it all started when the Starks dared to venture south.

Words: 421, Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Game of Thrones (TV)
  • Rating: Explicit
  • Warnings: Graphic Depictions Of Violence, Major Character Death, Underage
  • Categories: F/M
  • Characters: Jon Snow | Aegon Targaryen, Arya Stark, Ned Stark, Catelyn Tully Stark, Bran Stark, Robb Stark, Faceless Men (ASoIaF), Cersei Lannister, Jaime Lannister, Tyrion Lannister, Tywin Lannister, House Frey, Petyr Baelish, fucking littlefinger, Sansa Stark, because oh yeah - Character, she exists too, I ALMOST FORGOT - Character, Robert Baratheon, Joffrey Baratheon, except hes really just a lanisster, Tommen Baratheon, Myrcella Baratheon, Sand Snakes (ASoIaF), other evil and good people, Daenerys Targaryen, Drogon
  • Relationships: Jon Snow/Arya Stark, Jon Snow & Daenerys Targaryen, Arya Stark & Gendry Waters
  • Additional Tags: Adventure & Romance, dark ish maybe, Violence, Blood and Gore, DIREWOLVES FUCKERS, Time Travel, Time Travel Fix-It, Alternate Universe, Alternate Universe - Canon Divergence, dragon sibs cuz Drogon Viserion and Rheagal are so fricking cute

trail.content_raw:
by Lyze

“Take me,” she whispered to the Many-Faced-God. “Take me home.”

He granted her wish. Just not in the way she had imagined.

The Many-Faced-God had plans for her.

 

And, really, it all started when the Starks dared to venture south.

I just reblog and post random stuff that I like.

summary: One of my strangest ship that I can’t help shipping is Arya and Jaqen H'ghar. I don’t know that Master and Apprentice thing is...
body: One of my strangest ship that I can’t help shipping is Arya and Jaqen H'ghar. I don’t know that Master and Apprentice thing is like a forbidden fruit for me and I can’t help but liking that ship. Of course that’s not my OTP. I like Arya with Gendry much better than anyone else but Jaqen is like a guilty pleasure for me hahahaha

blog.name: jackoshadows
blog.title: Jak O' the Shadows
blog.description: I’m not going to swear an oath I can’t uphold. Talk about my father if you want. Tell me that’s the attitude that got him killed. But when enough people make false promises, words stop meaning anything. Then there are no more answers - only better and better lies. And lies won’t help us in this fight - Jon Snow.

tags: i'm so unaccustomed to writing for ayra so i feel like this is a bit shit???
i'm really sorry if it is y'all
summary:
Title: Dream Weaver
Fandom: Game of Thrones
Characters: Arya Stark x Reader
Word Count: 795
Warnings: None
Notes: Request from...
body:
Title: Dream Weaver

Fandom: Game of Thrones

Characters: Arya Stark x Reader

Word Count: 795

Warnings: None

Notes: Request from anon for, “65 and 79 with reader x Arya Stark?” Followed by “Sorry if I sent this already I just wasn’t sure if you got it and if I included the prompts so decided to send it again just to be sure. Can you do an Arya x female reader with the prompts ‘you’re hiding under the blanket because you’re blushing’ and ‘stop smiling at me like that, I keep messing up my sentences’?” // Thank you for specifying which prompts, sweet pea!! ☺ (I feel like this may be a little bit OOC, but I have a feeling that Arya would potentially be kinda cutesy with her partner if they were alone in a comfortable setting. ♥)

You found Arya Stark to be beautiful in any given situation, but had long ago decided that she was most beautiful when she was concentrated on something. Currently, she sat on her bed in Winterfell, the candlelight flickering in her grey eyes, and a few strands of hair falling into her face as she looked down upon the paper in front of her – you were certain that she’d never looked lovelier.

You were so busy admiring her that you didn’t even realize you were staring, an absentminded, loving smile on your lips.

“Stop smiling at me like that. I keep messing up my sentences,” Arya said, looking at you from beneath her lashes, the hint of a smirk on her lips.

“How can I not smile at something so gorgeous?” you questioned, and Arya’s smile widened, although she said nothing. “That would be impossible.”

Arya continued to stare down at the paper in her lap, pretending to read, although you knew she wasn’t giving it even a fraction of her attention. After all, she’d read and re-read it at least a hundred times already. One can only read the same thing so many times before losing interest.

“You truly are a sight, Arya Stark,” you declared, resting your chin on your hand and continuing to blatantly stare. “Your eyes are more captivating than a sunset, and your smile is twice as sweet as any lemon cake.”

Remaining silent, Arya merely tugged the nearby blanket up so that it covered her face, but you could tell by the glint in her eyes that she was grinning.

“You’re hiding under the blanket because you’re blushing,” you observed, then moved to sit next to her on the bed so that you could pull the blanket down. “You know how I adore your blush. I refuse to allow you to hide it from me.”

Arya giggled happily then, and your heart swelled. She so rarely laughed nowadays; you were constantly striving to make her do so, and you felt incredibly accomplished when you did.

“You’re too sweet to me, you know that?” Arya said, smiling at you.

“I would argue that you are the one who is too sweet to me. But I won’t, because I suspect we’d be arguing for hours on that subject.”

“I suspect you’re right,” Arya agreed, and you leaned forward to place a quick kiss on her lips.

“I know you want to make a good impression, but you worry far too much. I’m sure your letter is as perfect as it can possibly be. You should send it with the raven and then get some rest,” you declared, and Arya sighed.

“You’re right,” she muttered, then set the letter aside so she could stand and stretch. Before she had the chance to do much else, you stood behind her and wrapped your arms around her waist, resting your chin on her shoulder and placing a kiss on her jaw.

Arya sighed once more, but this time, it was more a sigh of content than of stress. She leaned back into you, resting her hands over yours and relishing in the warmth of your embrace as compared to the chill of the room. After a few moments of peaceful silence, she turned in your arms to place a kiss on your lips.

“I’m going to go send the raven. In the meantime, why don’t you add more wood to the fire, and when I return, you can tell me more about that new book of yours?”

“That sounds wonderful,” you said, kissing her nose before reluctantly releasing her.

You did as she suggested, and she returned shortly after, quick to crawl into bed beside you and rest her head on your shoulder.

The remainder of the evening was spent enjoying one another’s company, Arya listening patiently as you told her all about the book you had just finished. She’d said that she honestly enjoyed hearing your renditions of novels more than actually reading them. When you’d questioned that statement, she explained that she just liked the sound of your voice, and it never failed to sooth her. She’d been through a great deal in her young life, so you were more than happy to do whatever you could to aid her relaxation.

Shortly before you’d finished relaying the ending of the book, you noticed that Arya had begun to put her full weight on you, and her breathing had slowed. Upon glancing down at her, you noticed that her eyes were closed, and she was sound asleep. You placed a kiss on her forehead, then covered you both up with more blankets, and the comfort of her embrace did wonders to lull you to sleep, eagerly joining your love in the realm of dreams.

@whoabrekker @alexsunmners
